intro: Antidesma × kapuae, commonly known as the kapuac tree, is a hybrid plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical in shape, with a glossy surface and a reddish or purple underside. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, which are dispersed by wind or water.
